metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22637 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.3, Safari 15.4, watchOS 8.5, iOS 15.4 and iPadOS 15.4, tvOS 15.4. A malicious website may cause unexpected cross-origin behavior.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
